trustfund:
TF034238-BRAZIL - TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
            IN PROCUREMENT TRAINING AND REVIEW,TF027370-NORTHEAST BASIC EDUCATION,TF027360-SCIENCE RESEARCG AND TRAINING PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome was satisfactory,
            with a sustainable likelihood. Lessons outline the
            importance of measurable targets, and goals in project
            design, consistent to operations, and relevant to
            components, objectives, and outputs, for although the Annual
            Management Efficiency Targets was seemingly adequate, the
            reliability of measurable information was weak. The lack of
            a coherent, detailed implementation plan was partly
            conducive to delays, demonstrated among others, by the fact
            that construction requirements were not foreseen prior to
            actual implementation, revealing the lack of attentive
            preparation in a project involving international financing,
            aggravated by weak inter-governmental interventions, which
            affected systems management, human resources development,
            and the strengthening of management capacity. States should
            assist schools through their municipalities, reaching
            beneficiaries, by coordinating teacher training, school
            rehabilitation, and provision of textbooks to improve
            student learning. Thus, standardized teacher qualifications,
            and pedagogical inputs should be established, backed by
            technical assistance provision. These needs require a strong
            political will, evidenced as well, by the delays suffered in
            the development of the management information system, which
            despite substantial attention, and input, failed to deliver
            the necessary incentives to be adopted.
